data.title: The church and community center.
data.text:
As far as a tourist experience it is "a three" but spiritually it is "a five" star experience. Sacred Heart is a Catholic church in the midst of the troubled City of Camden. This 19th century graceful Christian temple is serving some of the poorest poor. You will notice the humble neighborhood surrounding the church. It is fairly safe to get to this church by car as it is located on relatively prominent streets but common sense vigilance is advised. The highlights of the interior include the wooden carvings. Admire also the simple classical beauty of the interiors. Best is to visit on Sunday during the mass.
The church offers social programs and appears to be a true pillar of this underprivileged community.

data.title: You will be inspired!
data.text: Absolutely magnificent church in the center of urban Camden. Do not miss a Sunday service. Music and soloist will make you cry and the congregation is so warm and friendly. GO!

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: Whether you are Catholic or not, the architecture, the stone carvings, especially the hand carved wood alcove structures, are absolutely beautiful! I have been there in the past for 2 of our sons Scout Sunday Mass! I cannot describe the honor of having it there! I would love to go back again with tour reservations! I definitely recommend this for the architecture & spiritual experience!

data.title: Wonderful Church, Incredible Sunday Services
data.text: Sacred Heart is in one of the poorest citiies in the United States.  The pastor is Fr. Michael Doyle and has transformed this parish to a vibrant and sacred spot on the planet.  The Sunday services are at 8 am and 10:30 am.  One of the most beautiful and alive Catholic services you will ever find. The parish has a school, they feed the poor, have a center for transformation and provide refurbished houses to low income folks.  Uf you live in the area or visiting, please go to Sacred Heart for a Sunday Mass.  You will be glad you did.
